column1: 0,msd_servo_drive.txt,248,1399a1208c15e6e7a2e1bbfecb3ea3d398b99753f805cebfa4bbd07949908208,"The xx in the filename stands for the data set number. Up to 100 data sets (0 to 99) can be saved.
This allows various different configurations to be saved in a servo drive as parameter data sets and then be called up as needed for the respective operational situation.
The parameter data sets can be loaded to the PC using an FTP script or from there back to the servo drive.
1. Using byte 1 of P 2010[0] - COM_CFG_ID specifies the options for the parameter data set.
1. Create a parameter data set in the file system /para/PDS00.dmd. The parameter data set is now saved in the servo drive with the selected name.
Transfer the parameter data set to the PC using the FTP script:
The following script can be used to transfer the parameter data set from the servo drive to the PC.
P No. Index Name Unit Description

column5: Access to the file system: Loading and saving of configuration files
-2 (ERROR) Error during RAM or MMC access
-1 (Running) = File creation is running
0 (Ready) = File creation is finished
18 Create parameter data set on FS.
19 Read parameter data set from FS and write to device parameters.
Access to file system: Assign additional parameter data set ID.
With byte 0: Specification of the parameter data set number.
Bit 0 of 2010[0] to bit 7 of 2010[0]
With byte 1: Specification of the options
Bit 0 = 1: Remove fieldbus-specific parameters from the data set.
Bit 1 = 1: Remove scope parameters from the data set.

column1: # 17.2.1 Write parameter data set to the file system
# 17.2.2 Loading the parameter data set from the file system

column3: Load the parameter set from the PC to the file system of the servo drive via FTP script:
The parameter data set is now present in the servo drive file system.
Enter the name of the parameter data set to be read with byte 0 of P 2010[0] - COM_CFG_ID: Specifies the name of the data set to be read. 0-99 means PDS00...PDS99.
Specify options with byte 1 of P 2010[0] - COM_CFG_ID: Specification of the options. Bit 0 = 1: Save the data set permanently to the non-volatile servo drive.
Read the parameter data from the file system and write to the device parameters. P 2009[0] - COM_CFG_File = 19.
If everything has worked properly, P 2009[0] - COM_CFG_File is automatically set to 0 = Ready once again. If there is an error, P 2009[0] - COM_CFG_File is set to -2 = error.

",What does the 'xx' in the filename represent in the context of the servo drive's parameter data sets?,"The 'xx' stands for the data set number, allowing up to 100 different data sets (0 to 99) to be saved.","In filenames, 'xx' indicates the parameter data set number, supporting a range from 0 to 99 for various configurations.","It represents the data set number, enabling the storage of up to 100 unique parameter configurations in the servo drive.","The 'xx' placeholder in filenames specifies the parameter data set number, accommodating configurations 0 through 99.","Signifying the data set number, 'xx' allows for the management of up to 100 distinct parameter data sets within the servo drive."

",How can parameter data sets be transferred between the PC and the servo drive?,"Parameter data sets can be transferred using an FTP script, either loading them to the PC or back to the servo drive.","Transfer is facilitated via FTP scripts, enabling the movement of parameter data sets to and from the servo drive's file system.","Using FTP scripts, users can upload parameter data sets from the servo drive to a PC or download them back to the drive.",The process involves FTP scripts to exchange parameter data sets between the PC and the servo drive's /para directory.,"FTP scripting is the method for transferring parameter data sets, allowing for both retrieval and upload operations between devices."

",What is the purpose of P 2009[0] - COM_CFG_File in the servo drive?,"P 2009[0] - COM_CFG_File provides access to the file system for loading and saving configuration files, including parameter data sets.","This parameter enables file system operations, such as creating (value 18) or reading (value 19) parameter data sets.","It controls file system access for configuration files, with specific values for creating or reading parameter data sets.","Used for managing configuration files, P 2009[0] supports operations like creating new parameter data sets on the file system.","The parameter facilitates configuration file management, including the creation and reading of parameter data sets via specified values."

",What options can be specified with byte 1 of P 2010[0] - COM_CFG_ID for the parameter data set?,Byte 1 of P 2010[0] allows specifying options like removing fieldbus-specific parameters (Bit 0) or scope parameters (Bit 1) from the data set.,Options include the removal of certain parameters: Bit 0 for fieldbus-specific and Bit 1 for scope parameters.,It enables customization of the parameter data set by excluding fieldbus-specific or scope parameters based on bit settings.,"Through byte 1, users can tailor the data set by excluding unnecessary parameters, enhancing flexibility for different operational needs.","This byte offers control over the data set's content, allowing the exclusion of specific parameter types to suit various configurations."

",How is a parameter data set created in the servo drive's file system?,"By setting P 2009[0] - COM_CFG_File to 18, a parameter data set is created in the file system, e.g., /para/PDS00.dmd.","A parameter data set is generated when P 2009[0] is set to 18, saving it under a specified name in the /para directory.","Creation involves assigning the value 18 to P 2009[0], which then saves the parameter data set in the designated file system location.","Setting COM_CFG_File to 18 initiates the creation of a parameter data set, stored within the servo drive's file system.","The process requires P 2009[0] to be set to 18, resulting in a new parameter data set saved in the /para folder with the given name."

",What steps are involved in loading a parameter data set from the file system to the servo drive?,"Steps include transferring the data set via FTP, specifying its name with P 2010[0], setting options, and reading it with P 2009[0] set to 19.","The process entails FTP transfer, naming the data set via P 2010[0], configuring options, and executing the read operation with P 2009[0].","Loading involves FTP upload, data set identification through P 2010[0], option specification, and initiating read with P 2009[0] as 19.","First, transfer the data set via FTP, then use P 2010[0] for naming, set desired options, and finally, read with P 2009[0] at 19.","After FTP transfer, define the data set name and options via P 2010[0], then activate reading by setting P 2009[0] to 19."

",What does the 'MSD ServoDrive - DeviceHelp' document provide information on?,"It offers detailed guidance on servo drive functions, including parameter data sets, configuration, and operational procedures.","The document covers servo drive functionalities, such as creating and managing parameter data sets, and various control methods.","Information includes servo drive operations, parameter management, and enhanced functions for optimal device utilization.","It serves as a comprehensive manual for servo drive features, including parameter data set handling and device configuration.","A resource for understanding servo drive capabilities, from basic operations to advanced parameter data set management."

Specify options with byte 1 of P 2010[0] - COM_CFG_ID: Specification of the options. Bit 0 = 1: Save the data set permanently to the non-volatile servo drive.
Read the parameter data from the file system and write to the device parameters. P 2009[0] - COM_CFG_File = 19.
If everything has worked properly, P 2009[0] - COM_CFG_File is automatically set to 0 = Ready once again. If there is an error, P 2009[0] - COM_CFG_File is set to -2 = error.

",How can users ensure the correct parameter data set is applied for a specific operational situation?,By selecting the appropriate data set number (0-99) and configuring P 2010[0] - COM_CFG_ID accordingly for the desired operational scenario.,Users must choose the relevant data set number and adjust P 2010[0] settings to match the operational requirements.,Applying the correct data set involves specifying its number and configuring P 2010[0] to align with the current operational needs.,Ensure the data set number and P 2010[0] configurations correspond to the operational situation for accurate application.,Matching the data set number with the operational context and setting P 2010[0] appropriately guarantees the correct configuration is used.
9,msd_servo_drive.txt,248,1399a1208c15e6e7a2e1bbfecb3ea3d398b99753f805cebfa4bbd07949908208,"The xx in the filename stands for the data set number. Up to 100 data sets (0 to 99) can be saved.
This allows various different configurations to be saved in a servo drive as parameter data sets and then be called up as needed for the respective operational situation.
The parameter data sets can be loaded to the PC using an FTP script or from there back to the servo drive.
1. Using byte 1 of P 2010[0] - COM_CFG_ID specifies the options for the parameter data set.
1. Create a parameter data set in the file system /para/PDS00.dmd. The parameter data set is now saved in the servo drive with the selected name.
Transfer the parameter data set to the PC using the FTP script:
The following script can be used to transfer the parameter data set from the servo drive to the PC.

18 Create parameter data set on FS.

Access to file system: Assign additional parameter data set ID.
With byte 0: Specification of the parameter data set number.
Bit 0 of 2010[0] to bit 7 of 2010[0]
With byte 1: Specification of the options
Bit 0 = 1: Remove fieldbus-specific parameters from the data set.
Bit 1 = 1: Remove scope parameters from the data set.

",What are the benefits of using parameter data sets in a servo drive?,"They allow for quick switching between different configurations, adapting the servo drive to varying operational requirements efficiently.","Parameter data sets enable the storage of multiple configurations, facilitating easy adaptation to different tasks or conditions.",The ability to save and recall configurations via data sets enhances operational flexibility and reduces setup times.,"Using data sets simplifies configuration management, allowing for rapid adjustments to meet diverse operational demands.","They provide a versatile solution for managing multiple operational scenarios, optimizing performance and productivity."
